Sheet1.Requirements: The System shall create a new project workspace.
The System shall assign a unique project ID/version to each new project workspace.
The System shall store intake inputs as structured fields.
The System shall preserve edit history for intake inputs.
The System shall store source-document references attached or linked by the PM.
The System shall link stored source-document references to intake fields for traceability.
The System shall evaluate intake sufficiency against SUFFICIENCY_TARGET_ARTIFACTS.
The System shall identify missing or ambiguous items required to satisfy SUFFICIENCY_RULESET_ID.
The System shall generate targeted follow-up questions to resolve missing or ambiguous intake inputs.
The System shall store PM answers as structured intake extensions.
The System shall tag intake extensions to the artifact(s) they unblock within SUFFICIENCY_TARGET_ARTIFACTS.
The System shall re-run sufficiency checks after intake extensions are captured.
The System shall continue prompting for follow-up inputs until SUFFICIENCY_RULESET_ID thresholds are met.
The System shall store constraints captured during intake.
The System shall classify constraints as business, technical, legal, or operational.
The System shall lock a baseline version of the intake dataset for downstream generation workflows.
The System shall run completeness and quality checks on the intake dataset according to INTAKE_QC_RULESET_ID.
The System shall expose the baselined intake dataset as the required input package for downstream generators.
The System shall start the context diagram generation workflow for the active project.
The System shall call an LLM using structured intake data and Q&A answers to propose external entities, boundary assumptions, and labeled interactions.
The System shall transform the LLM’s context model into a Cornell-style context diagram.
The System shall run context diagram quality checks according to CONTEXT_DIAGRAM_QC_RULESET_ID.
The System shall capture PM feedback as a structured change set for context entities, interactions, and assumptions.
The System shall apply the context change set and regenerate the context model as needed to maintain consistency.
The System shall baseline the approved context diagram and store both visual and structured representations with versioning.
The System shall start the use case model generation workflow for the current project.
The System shall automatically select the latest baselined Intake and Context Diagram as generation inputs.
The System shall call an LLM to propose actors, use cases, associations, and candidate include/extend relationships with conditions.
The System shall render the draft as a Cornell-style use case diagram.
The System shall run use case model checks according to UCD_QC_RULESET_ID.
The System shall convert PM feedback into a structured change set for the use case model.
The System shall apply the use case model change set and regenerate the model as needed to reflect PM feedback.
The System shall version each iteration of the use case model and preserve diffs.
The System shall baseline the approved use case model as an official input to UCBD generation and requirements extraction.
The System shall open a UCBD workspace and pre-fill the UCBD table columns (Primary Actor, The System, Other Actors/Elements, Interaction).
The System shall store preconditions and postconditions and prompt for missing testable state information.
The System shall call an LLM to generate a primary-flow UCBD using baselined intake, context diagram, and use case model inputs.
The System shall express system responsibilities as “The System shall …” functional statements and keep actor actions as verbs.
The System shall run UCBD quality checks according to UCBD_QC_RULESET_ID.
The System shall translate PM feedback into a structured change set against UCBD step numbers.
The System shall apply the UCBD change set and regenerate the UCBD as needed to reflect corrected sequence and wording.
The System shall create separate UCBD drafts for alternate or exception flows rather than mixing branching logic in one UCBD.
The System shall baseline approved UCBD(s) and mark them ready for requirements extraction.
The System shall start the PRD artifact generation workflow for the active project.
The System shall assemble the latest baselined inputs (Intake, Context Diagram, Use Case Model, UCBDs) into a PRD generation bundle.
The System shall extract candidate requirements from baselined UCBD(s) System swimlane statements into a requirements table with unique IDs and abstract function names.
The System shall generate a requirement constants definition table for constants referenced by requirements, including at minimum constant name, value, and units.
The System shall generate a SysML Activity Diagram (Level-0) representing the PRD package workflow and export it as editable model text.
The System shall package the Requirements Table, Constants Table, and SysML Activity Diagram as a PRD artifact bundle attached to the project version.
The System shall baseline the approved PRD artifact bundle with a version number.
